text: hi I'm Tony today I'm going to show you
how to change the identity source of
your AWS identity Center instance from
the internal directory to Microsoft
intra ID using SLE for user login and
skim for user
provisioning this video assumes that you
are already using IM am identity Center
for Access into your AWS environment
with users and groups stored in the
internal directory
and that you have set up inra ID and you
want to use that to manage those users
in groups in the
future when you enable I am identity
Center the service will authenticate
users against the internal identity
Center directory this works great and in
my environment I have created users and
groups which my team used to access our
AWS
accounts however now I want to change IM
IM identity Center to use Federated
identities from my company's corporate
identity provider which is intra ID so
that all of my staff can access ads
without needing to have a separate
identity and password to
remember as you will see in the next
couple of minutes this change is simple
quick and safe even if I get the
configuration wrong my existing users
and groups within identity Center will
be preserved and they will maintain all
of their existing access permission
if needed the change is also easily
reversible step one is to prepare the
users that already exist in IM am
identity
Center okay here I am viewing my IM
identity Center instance in the AWS
console in order for my existing users
to be accessible when logging into IM IM
identity Center using a sample based
identity provider such as intra ID
I have ensured that my usernames and IM
am identity Center are formatted as an
email address and that they match the
email address that the user has in my
identity
provider if your users usernames are not
currently set to their correct email
addresses and you want to continue using
those users you can use the identity
store update user API to update the
usern names as
required you can see here that I have a
couple of users in my I identity center
today and me and my team have been
successfully using these accounts to
access our AWS environment I identity
Center is the AWS recommended way for
your human Workforce to access AWS and
it's working great for us however we now
want to connect to our corporate
identity provider so that users can use
the same username and passwords to
access AWS that they use for other work
systems the usernames for my users are
already formatted as their correct email
addresses so I'm going to skip ahead to
the next
step step two is to change your identity
source and identity Center and download
the service provided metadata file
required to configure intra
ID as you'll notice changing the
configuration in IM identity Center is
simple and quick however there is a
chance that users could see some
Interruption if they try to sign in
while we are updating the IM identity
Center
configuration I have already let my team
know about this change so I'm ready to
go but you should plan to make this
change outside of normal working hours
and communicate this change to your
teams
appropriately in my browser I have
navigated to IM IM identity Center in
the AWS Management console and now I
will navigate to
settings under identity Source I will
choose to change change my identity
source and then here I will select
external identity
provider starting this process gives me
access to the service provider metadata
file from IM am identity Center which is
needed to configure intra ID so I will
download this file to my computer and
save it so I can use it in the next step
and then I will come back to complete
the rest of this form later
step three is to create and configure an
Enterprise application and entra ID to
represent I identity Center so I will
jump over to the entra ID admin Center
to create the Enterprise application you
first need to sign into the Microsoft
intra admin Center as a cloud
application
administrator I am already signed in so
now I will navigate to Identity
applications Enterprise applications and
then choose new application at the top
here I will enter AWS IM identity Center
into the search box and then I will
select and create AWS IM identity center
from the
results now that the Enterprise
application is created we need to
configure the attributes and claims in
entra ID so that users are correctly
identified when they are authenticated
to IM am identity Center
to do this I will click on single sign
on from the application's main page and
then click on saml here I will first
upload the metadata file that we
downloaded from IM am identity Center
earlier this contains the basic sample
configuration data that entra ID users
to connect to IM identity
Center once this is saved you should see
on the page that the basic sample
configuration has been
updated I I can then scroll down and
click edit on attributes and claims on
this page you need to verify the unique
user identifier or Name ID this claim is
how entra ID tells identity Center who
is signing in and the value must exactly
match the username of a user and IM IM
identity Center in most cases this
should be set to map to the value user.
mail as I'm setting it here and I also
need to make sure that the name
identifier format is set to email
address now that we have configured the
attributes and claims we're ready to
download the Federation metadata
XML this file contains the corresponding
details needed to configure IM identity
Center step four is to complete the
configuration in IM am identity Center
so I will go back to the IM identity
center console where we were before
under identity provider metadata we're
going to upload the Federation metadata
XML file that we downloaded from inra
ID the final step is then to acknowledge
what that what we were doing will change
how users will log in after we type
accept and click change identity Source
then users will not be able to log to
Identity Center until we have completed
the final conf configuration steps back
in intra
ad you should review These Warnings
carefully but also know that this change
is reversible and we can switch back to
the IM IM identity Center internal
directory at any time if we have issues
completing the
configuration after a few seconds the
configuration changes in IM am identity
Center are complete and we are ready to
finalize the SLE configuration and entra
ID
step five is where we will finish
configuring saml in inra ID by assigning
users to our
application here I am back in the intra
ID Enterprise application that we
created earlier to represent AWS
identity center with saml configured we
then need to assign users and groups to
the application only users in groups
assigned to the Enterprise application
in entra ID will be able to log into to
Identity Center regardless of whether
they have a user in identity Center's
directory or to put that another way
while the internal directory within IM
identity Center has remembered the user
accounts that we had before the
passwords of those users have now been
disabled the only way that users can now
log to IM IM identity Center is if they
have an intra ID user assigned to the
right application and have a matching
user and identity
Center to add users and groups to the
Enterprise application we click on users
and groups on the left and then select
add user or group at the top I'll save
you from having to watch me but I'll
repeat the step a few times until all of
my existing users that were using IM am
identity center before have been mapped
correctly now that my users and I am
identity Center are now all correctly
mapped to the application and entra ID
they should now be able to login to IM
am identity center with the intra ID
logins if any of my users encounter
errors logging in there are a few things
that I will check firstly I will ensure
that the user has an account and
identity Center if they do then secondly
verify that the attribute mapping for
Unique user identifier in enter ID is
correctly set
we configured that earlier in a previous
step finally you can always reach out to
AWS support for configuration
help step six is where we configure skim
at this point I have linked my IM
identity Center to entra ID using Sam
for authentication so my users are able
to log into AWS using their corporate
credentials however if people join or
leave my team those changes won't be
reflected in IM IM identity Center
automatically to ensure that my sets of
users are kept in sync I will now
configure automatic user provisioning so
that changes I make an entra ID are
replicated to IM am identity Center
automatically this replication is
facilitated by an industry standard
protocol called system for cross domain
identity management or skim for short
configuring skim is not required to use
IM am identity Center as I mentioned my
users can now log in fine but skim is
almost always recommended as we don't
want to have stray or orphaned user
accounts in our access control
system to set up skim we need to First
enable it in I am identity Center so
here in my am identity center console I
will go to settings and then click the
enable button on the automatic
provisioning box this has enabled the
skim API endpoint where my IM identity
Center instance can receive
notifications about changes to users or
groups I will take a copy of the skim
endpoint and the access token
details then I need to configure my inra
ID instance to send all user and group
changes to this endpoint to do this in
my intra ID console I will select
provisioning and then under manage
provisioning change the provisioning
mode to automatic
this will open the admin credentials
dropdown where I can set my skim
endpoint as the tenant URL and the
access token as the secret token to
check that I have entered everything
correctly I can test the connection
which confirms that connectivity was
successful and that my intad instance
can communicate with IM IM identity
Center so now I will hit
save now that the connection has been
established the final step is to tell
inra ID which users and groups should be
synchronized to IM identity Center not
everyone in my organization needs direct
access to the AWS environment and your
organization is probably similar with
that in mind I will edit provisioning
again scroll down to the settings box
and confirm that the scope is set to
sync only assigned users in groups this
means that instead of syncing all of my
users to IM identity Center only the
users in group to assigned to this
application within inra ID will be
synchronized now I can turn provisioning
on and hit
save so now that skim is configured I
can control who has access to I identity
Center by adding and removing groups
from my application in inra ID the one
thing to watch out for is that by
default inra ID will only replicate
users to I IM identity Center once every
40 minutes so it makes may take a little
bit of time before your users appear in
identity
Center of course it's also important to
note that newly added users will not
have any permissions in AWS by default
so after they are added via skim they
will be able to log into to IM identity
Center but they will not have access to
any of your AWS accounts to give them
access to your accounts you need to
assign permissions to the user within IM
IM identity Center
as you've seen in this video changing
your identity source to an external
identity provider in I am identity
Center is quick easy and safe you saw me
work through all of the required steps
firstly I prepared my users and ensured
that they had their username set to
their correct email
addresses then I changed the identity
Source in IM IM identity Center to
external provider and I configured the
provided details into inra D and then I
configured the corresponding details
into IM IM identity Center during this
time there would have been a few minutes
of interruption to my users logging in
so I was sure to schedule and
communicate this change
appropriately finally I assigned the
correct users to the application in
entro ID and configured skim to keep my
users and groups in sync this whole
process only took a few minutes and now
my users can log in successfully with
their corporate credentials
if you have any issues in your
configuration there are a few key things
to remember firstly this process does
not delete any of your users permissions
or assignments in am identity Center and
if you need to you can switch back to
using the identity Center internal
directory at any time if your users have
issues logging in then the first thing
to check is the attribute mapping
configured an enter ID ensure that the
user identifier is to user
mail if your users are failing to appear
in IM identity Center as you expect them
to remember that skim synchronization
only runs once every 40 minutes you may
just need to wait a little longer for
your users to
appear and as always if you have any
issues please reach out to AWS support
who can help you through the
configuration they are here to help
thanks for watching
